description: From a series of four etchings for the story "Der Rebell" by Manfred Georg, Heinrich Hochstim-Verlag, Berlin, 1918; full length image of a man on right side wearing a long coat and boots standing on a table; his intestines are exposed and falling from a large opening in his abdomen; in the lower left corner are the heads of three men; above the heads in the background are a number of smaller less defined figures coming toward the figures in the foreground; in the lower right corner is a small house wtih two windows and a door
inscription: LL margin of sheet, in pencil: Dr. Rauert E.121-II | UR of sheet, in pencil: 2.
portfolio: From Plate 3 from Der Rebell (The Rebel), Manfred Georg, Heinrich Hochstim-Verlag, Berlin, 1918
signed: LR in pencil, below image: Walter Gramatté / 18. | LL in pencil, below image: Zu Manfred Georg : \"der Rebell\" / (Marsyas)
title: Scene in the Cafe with the War-Wounded, Plate 3 from Der Rebell (The Rebel)
